conclusion: Analyze paths from points A, B, C, and D to determine which container liquid will flow into.
Liquid flows downward from point A.
Liquid from point A encounters a baffle directing it to the right.
Liquid from point A continues downward into container E.
Liquid flows downward from point B.
Liquid from point B encounters a baffle directing it to the right.
Liquid from point B continues downward into container E.
Liquid flows downward from point C.
Liquid from point C encounters a baffle directing it to the left.
Liquid from point C continues downward into container F.
Liquid flows downward from point D.
Liquid from point D encounters a baffle directing it to the left.
Liquid from point D continues downward into container F.
Liquids from points A and B flow into container E.
Liquids from points C and D flow into container F.
Final answer: Liquid from points A and B will flow into container E, and liquid from points C and D will flow into container F.
